intro: Potamogeton lindenbergii, commonly known as Lindenberg's pondweed, is a submerged aquatic plant native to freshwater environments in North America. It has long, slender, ribbon-like leaves that are typically arranged in whorls around the stem. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often submerged, with staminate and pistillate flowers occurring on separate plants. It plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms. Its presence is often an indicator of good water quality in its habitat.
